snippet: Against Mitt Romney in Michigan, Rick Santorum had a serious chance to score a upset significant enough to have changed the contours of the nomination race.
abstract: FiveThirtyEight blog; Rick Santorum may have missed his best chance to score a significant upset victory against Mitt Romney in Michigan, where Romney's strong ties would have cast his campaign in a particularly unfavorable light had he lost; Super Tuesday contests will occur in states where Romney's outlook is less promising, making potential Santorum victories less dramatic.
lead_paragraph: Against Mitt Romney in Michigan, Rick Santorum had a serious chance to score a upset significant enough to have changed the contours of the nomination race.

headline.main: Missed Opportunity for Rivals of Romney, but Another Looms
headline.print_headline: Missed Opportunity for Rivals Of Romney, but Another Looms
